intro: Antirrhinum majus var. longeracemosum, commonly known as the long-stemmed snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of tubular, bilabiate flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous flowers along its branches. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its botanical features make it an attractive and versatile ornamental plant.
